item.title: Today’s Wordle #1643: Hints and Answer for December 18, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1643 for December 18, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, December 18, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1643 will give most players a challenge. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 5.5 of 6 guesses. That makes over a full guess harder than the 4-guess average from December 17.

General Wordle Hints For December 18

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word is far more likely to appear in headlines or standings than in casual conversation.
  • Hint 2: It’s commonly paired with words like union, league, match, or club.
  • Hint 3: The word is often used unchanged across different countries, even where the surrounding language differs.
  • Hint 4: In many places, hearing this word immediately signals a physical, fast-moving activity rather than an object.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1643 for December 18, 2025

Starter Words For December 18, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • BUYER
  • BURST
  • ROUGH
  • RUDER

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1643 On December 18, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: RUGBY

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

Plead is a noun that represents a “form of football played between two teams of 15 members each, that differs from soccer in freedom to carry the ball, block with the hands and arms, and tackle, and is characterized chiefly by continuous action and prohibition against the use of substitute players.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1642 on December 17, 2025:

Answer: GRASS

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1643?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on December 19 will be Wordle Game #1644.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you’d like tips and clues for in the comments below and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Fallout Crossover Announced For Black Ops 7 Season 1 Reloaded
item.content:encoded:
It makes sense for Activision and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 to capitalize on the Fallout Season 2 Amazon launch, and Black Ops 7 Season 1 Reloaded will see the two massive franchises collide.

Fallout Season 2’s Rotten Tomatoes score is higher than Season 1. The brand is hot stuff once again, and this comes hot off the heels of new Fallout updates. So, why not bring Call of Duty and Fallout together to deliver an epic crossover in Black Ops 7 Season 1 Reloaded?

That’s precisely what’s happening.

Black Ops 7 Season 1 Reloaded Welcomes Fallout To Its Lands

The official Call of Duty X channel announced the Fallout crossover and gave everyone a clear timeframe on when to expect it—Season 1 Reloaded.

Black Ops 7 carries on where previous CoD titles have left off by offering new seasonal updates every few weeks. Slapped in the middle of this is a ‘Reloaded’ update, offering new maps, modes, and guns, and sometimes special crossovers and events.

We know that Fallout has eyed up a primetime spot during this period, per the social media message:

“Okie dokie – stay focused, stay alive. @FalloutonPrime is coming to Call of Duty in Season 01 Reloaded.”

There was a lot of talk before BLOPS 7 launched about the nature of unrealistic skins. It was revealed back in August that Black Ops 6 content would not carry forward into Black Ops 7. But Activision has never ruled out crossovers with brands.

Certain Black Ops 7 skin collabs were cancelled after player feedback, but Treyarch senior director of production, Yale Miller, has previously stated that the game will have “Grounded” skins that “Make sense for Black Ops 7.

It’s not explicitly confirmed that the crossover includes Fallout skins, but it’s a logical assumption.

Is Fallout a natural fit for a Call of Duty crossover? Is Nuketown destined for a Fallout-themed variation? Share your thoughts through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Read about Hogwarts Legacy selling 40 million units and Netflix announcing a new FIFA game ahead of the 2026 World Cup for more news.
